name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Shooting stones in the foot again
On February 10, CCTV News reported that the content of the radioactive element cesium 137 in Japanese seabass exceeded the standard, which is 50Bp per kilogram. The result was 84.5Bp per kilogram.
As soon as the report came out, a large number of netizens in the comment area accused Japan of discharging nuclear wastewater.
However, some netizens checked that the national food radiation standard GB14882-94 stipulates that Chinaâ€™s seafood safety standard for cesium is 800Bp per kilogram.
In other words, the current Japanese seabass is ten times better than Chinese standards.
